name: Stakeholders
definition: The people, groups, or organizations who affect or are affected by a software system.
description: The stakeholders provide the opportunity, and are the source of the requirements for the software system. They are involved throughout the software engineering endeavor to support the team and ensure that an acceptable software system is produced.

checklists.name: Team agrees on relevant stakeholder groups to be represented
Responsibilities of stakeholder representatives are defined
Representatives respect team's way of working
Stakeholder representatives empowered to take on responsibilities
Stakeholder representatives provide feedback & take part in decisions in timely way
Stakeholder representatives promptly communicate to stakeholder group
Stakeholder representatives agree to take on responsibilities
Stakeholder representatives agreed upon minimal expectations for deployment
Stakeholder representatives confirm system ready for deployment
Stakeholders provide feedback on their experiences with the deployed system
Stakeholders confirm that system meets their expectations

name: Opportunity
definition: The set of circumstances that makes it appropriate to develop or change a software system.
description: The opportunity articulates the reason for the creation of the new, or changed, software system. It represents the team’s shared understanding of the stakeholders’ needs, and helps shape the requirements for the new software system by providing justification for its development.

checklists.name: An idea for a software solution is identified
Stakeholders wish to make an investment in better understanding potential value
Opportunity addresses problem and stakeholder needs
Need for a software solution is confirmed
Projected value of software system established
Operational use of solution creates tangible benefits
Risks associated with solution are acceptable and manageable
Impact of solution on stakeholders understood

name: Requirements
definition: This area of concern covers everything to do with the specification and development of the software system.
description: The goal of software engineering is to develop working software as part of the solution to some problem. Any method adopted must describe a set of practices to help the team produce good quality software in a productive and collaborative fashion.

checklists.name: Assumptions made while defining requirements are captured
Purpose and extent of system are agreed
List of high-level requirements captures system purpose
Implemented requirements satisfy the need for a new system
Stakeholders agree implemented requirements are worth making operational
Processes and tools for handling requirements are in place
There are no outstanding requirements to be implemented

name: Software System
definition: A system made up of software, hardware, and data that provides its primary value by the execution of the software.
description: A software system can be part of a larger software, hardware, business or social solution.

checklists.name: Stakeholders agree on support service levels
Critical interfaces and system configurations demonstrated
Selected architecture addresses key technical risks
Criteria for selecting architecture are agreed
System has desired quality and performance characteristics
System is in use in operational environment
Buy, build, reuse decisions are made
System is available to intended users
System is updated to newer technologies or platforms
System is supported to agreed service levels
Relevant stakeholders agree architecture is appropriate
System is replaced or no longer supported
Issues and bugs are tracked and resolved

name: Team
definition: The group of people actively engaged in the development, maintenance, delivery and support of a specific software system.
description: The team plans and performs the work needed to create, update and/or change the software system.

checklists.name: Where and how the work is carried out are defined
Members know how to perform their work
Team can grow to achieve opportunity
Team's objectives are aligned with personal objectives
Team organization, responsibilities, and roles are understood
Members are working as one unit
Team has enough resources to start addressing opportunity

name: Way-of-Working
definition: The tailored set of practices and tools used by a team to guide and support their work.
description: The team evolves their way of working alongside their understanding of their mission and their working environment. As their work proceeds they continually reflect on their way of working and adapt it to their current context, if necessary.

checklists.name: Team commits to values and principles
Stakeholders accept team's values and principles
Practices and tools are consistent with values and principles
Team reflects on practices, tools, principles, and values
A transition plan is defined to adopt new practices and tools
Stakeholders accept external-facing practices and tools
Team naturally applies practices and tools
Key practices and tools are ready
Practices and tools are identified to address team's needs
Team continues to tune practices and tools
Practices and tools naturally support team
Team fully embraces principles and values
Team is adopting practices, tools, principles, and values
Constraints about practices and tools are known
Team is adapting practices and tools

name: Work
definition: Activity involving mental or physical effort done in order to achieve a result.
description: In the context of software engineering, work is everything that the team does to meet the goals of producing a software system matching the requirement and addressing the opportunity presented by the stakeholders. The work is guided by the practices that make up the team’s way-of-working.

checklists.name: A credible plan is in place
Resources to start work are in place
Plan is revised to reflect team's performance
Work items are being completed at a steady pace
Team members are progressing on work items
Work is broken down into actionable items with clear definitions of done
Progress metrics are tracked and acted upon
